  • hippomaps.fetcher.get_map

hippomaps.fetcher.get_map

hippomaps.fetcher.get_map(repo='HippoMaps-initializationMaps', Dataset='*', Method='*', Modality='*', hemi='*', den='*', extension='.shape.gii')

Searches and loads data from OSF with specified parameters (default ‘*’ unless specified otherwise) See https://osf.io/92p34/ for examples :param repo: Top level repo (default ‘HippoMaps-initializationMaps’) :type repo: str :param Dataset: Source of the map :type Dataset: str :param Method: Method being used (e.g. ‘MRI’, ‘MRI-7T’ or ‘histology’) :type Method: str :param Modality: Modality within the Method (e.g. ‘qT1’, ‘FA’, or ‘Merker’) :type Modality: str :param hemi: Hemisphers (e.g. ‘L’, ‘*’, or ‘mix’) :type hemi: str :param den: Only search for data that is already a given density (e.g. ‘0p5mm’ or ‘unfoldiso’). Note that data can always be resampled to a different density after loading! :type den: str :param extension: Typically this is ‘.shape.gii’, but it could also be ‘.func.gii’ or ‘.label.gii’ :type extension: str

Returns:

  • data (list) – list of arrays containing data that matched search terms

  • names (list) – list of filenames that matched search terms
